sentences.english: Oh, darling, refresh our memory. Our silver wedding anniversary is coming.
sentences.chinese: 噢，亲爱的，回忆一下，我们的银婚纪念日快到了。

sentences.english: This was given us as a present on the occasion of our silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们银婚纪念时，收到的礼物。

sentences.english: He and Helen celebrated their silver wedding last year.
sentences.chinese: 他和海伦去年庆祝了他们的银婚。

sentences.english: All of us must come together for the parents' silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 全家必须团聚，以庆祝父母的银婚。

sentences.english: The family must come together for the parents' silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 全家必须聚会庆祝父母的银婚。

sentences.english: We had a party to celebrate Mother's sliver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我们举行了晚会庆祝母亲的银婚纪念。

sentences.english: The couple gave a dinner party in celebration of their silver wedding anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 这对夫妇设宴庆祝他们的银婚纪念日。

sentences.english: We had a tea party to celebrate our headmaster's silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我们为庆祝校长的银婚举行了一次茶会。

sentences.english: The party was in celebration of my parents'silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 聚会是为了庆祝我父母的银婚。
这次聚会是为了庆祝母亲银婚。

sentences.english: The party was in celebration of Mother’s silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 这次聚会是为纪念母亲的银婚而举行的。

sentences.english: The family must come together for the parent silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 全家必须团聚，以庆祝父母的银婚。

sentences.english: On Friday, the 10th instant, Mr. and Mrs. Cole celebrated their silver wedding-day.
sentences.chinese: 科尔夫妇于本月10日星期五庆祝他们的银婚。

sentences.english: We are planning to have a party to celebrate our parents' silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 我们将举行一个晚会来庆祝父母的银婚。

sentences.english: They had a party to celebrate their silver wedding.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行聚会来庆祝他们的银婚。

sentences.english: Silver Wedding marks 25 years of marriage.
sentences.chinese: 银婚表示结婚二十五年了。

definition: length of married life/marriageable age/actual marrying age
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
(in former times) to bind one's hair on coming of age
(to live together until the) white hairs of old age (idiom); to live to a ripe old age in conjugal bliss/until death do us part
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
love is more solid than gold (idiom)
